message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering the sparsity pattern of an unknown sparse vector from a limited number of noisy linear measurements, which is a fundamental problem in compressed sensing. Therefore, cs.SP (Signal Processing) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the measurement rate needed to attain a desired fraction of errors, which involves optimization and computational complexity, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also mentions the near optimality of the recovery algorithms for a wide variety of signal models, which suggests that cs.MM (Multimedia) could be a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper provides bounds on the measurement rate in terms of various key parameters of the unknown vector, which involves numerical analysis and optimization, making cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) a possible sub-category.
